com.blukii.infosdk

Class BlukiiClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient

  • public class BlukiiClient
extends java.lang.Object

    Main controller class for discovering BLE modules and resolving blukii concerned data from the blukii Info Manager.

    BlukiiClient is a single point of contact for all data retrieving actions as follows:
    • Discovering BLE modules, extracting BLE data and resolving data from blukii Info Manager (https://manager.blukiiinfo.com)
    • Resolving data for a single blukii module or tag from blukii Info Manager
    • Resolving news from blukii Info Manager




    A. Discover BLE modules, extract their BLE data and resolve their data from blukii Info Manager

    Use this feature to discover BLE modules in your environment and optionally retrieve corresponding data from blukii Info Manager.

    To do this you have to do the following steps:

    1. Initialize and start discovery

    Call initDiscovery(OnDiscoveryListener) and implement the OnDiscoverListener callbacks.
    After initialization is ready (callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onInitialized(Context) you can start the discovery. 
      
  @Override
  protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
      mBlukiiClient = new BlukiiClient(context);
      mBlukiiClient.initDiscovery(blukiiDiscoveryListener);
  }

  BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener blukiiDiscoveryListener = new BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener() {

      @Override
      public void onInitialized(Context context) {
          // Discovery successfully initialized
          if (mBlukiiClient.startDiscovery()) {
              // Discovery successfully started
          }
      }

      @Override
      public void onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList discoveryResultList) {

      }

      @Override
      public void onError(BlukiiClient.ErrorCode errorCode) {

      }

      @Override
      public void onInfo(BlukiiClient.InfoCode infoCode) {

      }
  };

    2. Configure discovery settings

    Use the DiscoverySettings object for configuring discovery.
    Call getDiscoverySettings() to retrieve the settings property set. 
      

      @Override
      public void onInitialized(Context context) {
          // Discovery successfully initialized

          // change discovery settings
          DiscoverySettings discoverySettings = mBlukiiClient.getDiscoverySettings();
          discoverySettings.setRssiThreshold(-100);
          discoverySettings.setScanDuration(10000);
          ...

          if (mBlukiiClient.startDiscovery()) {
              // Discovery successfully started
          }
      }
    When BLE scanner is started the BLE discovery is acting according to the DiscoverySettings:
    • The scanner is searching for BLE modules inside the defined rssi range (DiscoverySettings.getRssiThreshold()).

    • After one scan duration (DiscoverySettings.getScanDuration()) the results are called back to (BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList)).

    • If there is no scan wait duration defined (DiscoverySettings.getScanWaitDuration()) the next scan duration starts immediately. This is repeated until BLE Scanning is stopped by stopDiscovery().

    • Internally after every scan duration the BLE scanner is stopped and started for new run. This is told by the callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onInfo(com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient.InfoCode)

    • If the scanner is paused according to the DiscoverySettings the info BlukiiClient.InfoCode.INFO_DISCOVERY_PAUSED is called.

    3. Configure resolver settings

    Use the ResolveSettings object for configuring the resolving of the blukii Info Manager data.
    Call getResolveSettings() to retrieve the settings property set.

    Note: ResolveSettings.setResolveEnabled(boolean) has to be set true to enable the resolver! 
      

      @Override
      public void onInitialized(Context context) {
          // Discovery successfully initialized

          // change discovery settings
          DiscoverySettings discoverySettings = mBlukiiClient.getDiscoverySettings();
          discoverySettings.setRssiThreshold(-100);
          discoverySettings.setScanDuration(10000);
          ...


          // change resolver settings
          ResolveSettings resolveSettings = mBlukiiClient.getResolveSettings();
          resolveSettings.setResolveEnabled(true);
          resolveSettings.setLanguagePriority(new String[]{ResolveSettings.OUTPUTLANGUAGE_ENGLISH,
                                                          ResolveSettings.OUTPUTLANGUAGE_GERMAN});
          ...


          if (mBlukiiClient.startDiscovery()) {
              // Discovery successfully started
          }
      }

    4. Retrieve results

    The callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList) will be called after finishing every discovery phase. It retrieves the discovered list of OutputElements.

    Note: If no BLE modules have been found discoveryResultList is empty (not null). 
      

      @Override
      public void onDiscoveryResult(ArrayList discoveryResultList) {
          // Discovery phase has finished: list of OutputElements are retrieved
          int count = discoveryResultList.size();
          for (OutputElement outputElement : discoveryResultList) {
              String id = outputElement.getId();
              short rssi = outputElement.getDiscoveryData().getRssi();
              ...
          }
      }

    5. Retrieve errors and infos

    The callbacks BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onError(com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient.ErrorCode) and BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onInfo(com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient.InfoCode) will be called if there is important information about the discovery or resolving process. 
      

      @Override
      public void onError(BlukiiClient.ErrorCode errorCode) {
          // An error has been sent from discovery or resolver
      }

      @Override
      public void onInfo(BlukiiClient.InfoCode infoCode) {
          // An info has been sent from discovery or resolver
      }

    B. Resolve data for a single blukii module or tag from blukii Info Manager

    Retrieve data for a module or tag from blukii Info Manager by calling resolveInputElement(InputElement, OnResolveInputElementListener).

    You have to prepare an InputElement that stands for a blukii number, NFC tag or scan result. Please see InputElement.InputElement(String, InputSourceType) for more Information

    If the resolving process is successfull the callback BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener.onResolveResult(OutputElement) is called.
    Otherwise the callback BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener.onError(com.blukii.infosdk.InputElement, com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient.ErrorCode) lets you know the error of the resolving process. 
      
   private void resolveSingleElement() {
      // call resolver
      InputElement inputElement = new InputElement("01234567890ABCD", InputSourceType.NFC);
      mBlukiiClient.resolveInputElement(inputElement, onResolveInputElementListener);
   }


   private BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener onResolveInputElementListener = new BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener() {

      @Override
      public void onResolveResult(OutputElement outputElement) {
              String id = outputElement.getId();
              String url = outputElement.getResolveData.getUrl();
      }

      @Override
      public void onError(InputElement inputElement, BlukiiClient.ErrorCode errorCode) {
          // An error has been sent from resolver
      }

  }

    C. Resolving news from blukii Info Manager

    Retrieve a translated news text from the blukii Info Manager.

    If the resolving process is successful the callback BlukiiClient.OnResolveServerNewsListener.onNewsResult(String) is called.
    Otherwise the callback BlukiiClient.OnResolveServerNewsListener.onError(com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient.ErrorCode) lets you know the error of the resolving process. 
      
  public void resolveNews(Context context) {

      mBlukiiClient.resolveServerNews("en-en", new BlukiiClient.OnResolveServerNewsListener() {
          @Override
          public void onNewsResult(String news) {
              // news retrieved
          }

          @Override
          public void onError(BlukiiClient.ErrorCode errorCode) {
              // An error has been sent from resolver
          }
      });
  }

      • initDiscovery

        public void initDiscovery(BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener onDiscoveryListener)
        Initializes the discovery service.

        If successful, the callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onInitialized(Context) is called.
        Otherwise the callback BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener.onError(com.blukii.infosdk.BlukiiClient.ErrorCode) is called with BlukiiClient.ErrorCode.ERROR_DISCOVERYSERVICE_START_FAILED.

        Note: By calling this function the service instance DeviceDiscoveryService is started and binded by the BlukiiClient object.
        This is required before calling startDiscovery() and stopDiscovery() for starting and stopping the discovery for BLE modules.
        Without startDiscovery() DeviceDiscoveryService is not do any action and therefore not using the battery.
        Parameters:
        onDiscoveryListener - listener interface for callbacks
        See Also:
        isDiscoveryInitialized(), startDiscovery(), stopDiscovery()

      • isDiscovering

        public boolean isDiscovering()
        Gets the state if BLE scanner is actually running.
        Returns:
        true, if BLE scanner is scanning
        See Also:
        startDiscovery(), stopDiscovery()

      • isDiscoveryInitialized

        public boolean isDiscoveryInitialized()
        Gets the state if the discovery service is initialized.
        Returns:
        true, if discovery service is initialized

      • resolveInputElement

        public void resolveInputElement(InputElement inputElement,
                       BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener onResolveInputElementListener)
        Starts the resolver to retrieve blukii Info Manager data of one single element.

        Results will be asynchronously returned with the callbacks of the BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener interface

        Note: ResolveSettings.getLanguagePriority() is the only property that takes affect for resolving single elements.
        All other ResolveSettings properties are affecting the discovery process only!
        Parameters:
        inputElement - input data with specified format, therefore see InputElement.InputElement(String, InputSourceType)
        onResolveInputElementListener - listener interface for callbacks
        See Also:
        BlukiiClient.OnResolveInputElementListener, InputElement, ResolveSettings.getLanguagePriority()

      • resolveServerNews

        public void resolveServerNews(java.lang.String languageId,
                     BlukiiClient.OnResolveServerNewsListener onResolveServerNewsListener)
        Starts the resolver to retrieve a translated blukii Info Manager news text.

        Results will be asynchronously returned by the callbacks of the BlukiiClient.OnResolveServerNewsListener interface
        Parameters:
        languageId - language code for the translation, supported languages: ResolveSettings.OUTPUTLANGUAGE_ENGLISH or ResolveSettings.OUTPUTLANGUAGE_GERMAN
        onResolveServerNewsListener - listener interface for callbacks
        See Also:
        BlukiiClient.OnResolveServerNewsListener

      • startDiscovery

        public boolean startDiscovery()
        Starts the BLE scanner.

        It only can be started if the discovery service has been initialized before by calling initDiscovery(OnDiscoveryListener)!

        Note: Only when the BLE scanner is started successfully the BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener callbacks are called if there is any discovery result, error or info.

        You can stop scanning by calling stopDiscovery().
        Returns:
        true, if start is successful.
        See Also:
        stopDiscovery(), isDiscoveryInitialized(), BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener

      • stopDiscovery

        public boolean stopDiscovery()
        Stops the BLE scanner.

        You can start scanning by calling startDiscovery().
        Returns:
        true, if stop is successful.
        See Also:
        startDiscovery(), BlukiiClient.OnDiscoveryListener
